title: Sr. Solutions Architect, Professional Services, Data Migration
content:
BE PART OF BUILDING THE FUTURE.
What do NASA and emerging space companies have in common with COVID vaccine R&D teams or with Roblox and the Metaverse? 
The answer is data, -- all fast moving, fast growing industries rely on data for a competitive edge in their industries. And the most advanced companies are realizing the full data advantage by partnering with Pure Storage. Pure’s vision is to redefine the storage experience and empower innovators by simplifying how people consume and interact with data. With 11,000+ customers including 58% of the Fortune 500, we’ve only scratched the surface of our ambitions. 
Pure is blazing trails and setting records:
For ten straight years, Gartner has named Pure a leader in the Magic Quadrant 
Our customer-first culture and unwavering commitment to innovation have earned us a certified Net Promoter Score in the top 1% of B2B companies globally
Industry analysts and press applaud Pure’s leadership across these dimensions
And, our 5,000+ employees are emboldened to make Pure a faster, stronger, smarter company as we go
If you, like us, say “bring it on” to exciting challenges that change the world, we have endless opportunities where you can make your mark.SHOULD YOU ACCEPT THIS CHALLENGE...
As a Sr. Solution Architect, you will utilize your strong consulting and technical competencies in the field of Block, File, and Object data transition to Pure storage solutions, to provide the highest level of transition architecting, and planning capability, and technical consultation to customers, Pure team, and Pure partners. 
You will work in cross-functional teams including Product and Services Sales, Product Marketing, Business Development Managers, Product Engineering, Services Engineering to scope and help to position Professional Services Solutions for homogeneous and heterogeneous product solutions to customers/partners. You will become intimately acquainted with the customer's/partner’s business requirements, technical needs, systems, environment and service history, enabling you to present targeted solutions to our customer base. You will design and plan the implementation of the services solutions for our customers and will be expected to be a technical lead of the hands-on team delivering these services across the world. The role covers customer facing pre-sales and delivery functions, and you will be comfortable with performing either role as demand dictates.
You will possess a thorough understanding of modern datacenter and hybrid cloud IT architecture, designing solutions, networking and implementation of these solutions. You must have significant experience across enterprise storage platforms, different data migration technologies for SAN, NAS, Object, CAS, know most enterprise class operating systems, and be comfortable with SAN fabrics and NAS networking solutions. You will also be experienced in delivering large scale and complex projects utilizing all the mentioned offerings and will also be skilled in scripting to enable automation of these processes where appropriate.
Solutions Architects work with customers, sales teams, engineering, and Pure partners to:
Help customers to determine the best way to achieve their business objectives on projects that involve data migrations. 
Lead the data migration conversations, provide architecture, and solution to address the data migration needs. 
Translate customer business requirements to migration solution that will support achieving them
Be an expert in Pure migration methodology. Explain how methodology helps to mitigate data migration risks at the customer environment. 
Conduct detailed technical discovery of a customer environment.
Perform customer environment and data analysis, identify areas of focus for the delivery team
Create a comprehensive end-to-end data migration plan that will support achieving customer desired outcomes
Be a Pure storage product expert consulting customers on the best practice implementation techniques. 
Advise and consult on Pure solution implementation strategies that will help to address customer needs around areas like active clustering, DR replication, disaster recovery, monitoring and others.
Have expertise in performing all data migration tasks, able to lead and coach on them as necessary. 
Lead a team of migration engineers through a migration execution phase
Be an SME in at least 4 data migration areas (Block data migration, NFS, SMB/CIFS, Object, Compute, Application based migration, Host based migration)
Provide support for the technical issues related to the migration architecture implementation. 
Develop scripts for both integration of Pure storage into a customer’s operational environment and the automation of replication, clustering, cloud and data migrations.
WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO BRING TO THIS ROLE...
Excellent business focused verbal and written communication skills
Ability to tailor messaging to the specific audience – sales, management, technical etc. 
Ability to explain complex technical issues in a simple easy to understand way
Be a technical expert around data migration techniques
Storage solutions deployment experience in the enterprise environment
Flash Array experience / Replication technologies (Active Cluster or similar)
Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure and other cloud-based offerings.
Data Center Migrations/Consolidations/Toolsets
Networking concepts and high-level designs
Cirrus Data Solutions Appliance (or Appliance based solutions for migrating block data)
Virtualization Tools - Cisco/Microsoft/VMWare (Cloud solutions)
Proven experience of scripting languages such as Perl, Shell, Powershell, Visual Basic, Python.
Networking infrastructure (Nexus / ACI / Broadcom / Brocade)
Security/Firewalls
Other technical platform or infrastructure migration tools such as Logical Volume Manager (LVM), Datadobi, Komprise.
Multi-vendor server and storage platforms and performance tuning experience.
Operational knowledge of Windows, AIX, Unix, HP-US, Solaris, Linux Operating systems
Knowledge of Hyper-V and VMWare ESXi 
Preparation and delivery of technical and architecture solution
Contribute significant portions for data migration solutions to RFPs, RFQs and RFIs
Superior knowledge of current and emerging storage architectures (FC, iSCSI, CIFS/SMB, NFS, S3, OSD, SAN)
Knowledge of Local Area Networking, Ethernet, TCP/IP and general networking
Excellent English verbal and written communication skills, any additional languages are a definite benefit 
Team leadership skills
Bi-lingual (multi-lingual a huge+)
BS in CS, EE or other technical degree and/or equivalent experience.
Education
8+ years of experience
A Bachelor of Science Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering; or related field is required; a Graduate Degree is preferred.
Experience which demonstrates a significant level of expertise in designing and delivering complex data migration solutions across heterogenous storage platforms.
Will also look for Qualified candidates that have
Specialized knowledge in breadth and/or depth in data migration tool sets (specifically the Cirrus Data Appliance) and disciplines
Understanding of enterprise applications like Oracle, SAP, SQL
Experience with deploying storage solutions in containerized and public cloud environments. 
Strong aptitude for learning new technologies and understanding how to utilize them in a customer facing environment.
Ability to follow standard engineering principles and practices.
Creative approach to problem solving.
Travel to the prospective customer's domestic sites and other global sites as necessary.
The annual base salary range is: $98,000 - $212,000. Salary ranges are determined based on role, level and location. For positions open to candidates in multiple geographical locations, the base salary range is reflective of the labor market across the applicable locations.This role may be eligible for incentive pay and/or equity.And because we understand the value of bringing your full and best self to work, we offer a variety of perks to manage a healthy balance, including flexible time off, wellness resources, and company-sponsored team events - check out purebenefits.com for more information. #LI-RS #LI-RemoteBE YOU—CORPORATE CLONES NEED NOT APPLY.
Pure is where you ask big questions, think differently, and make an impact. This is not just a job, but a place where you have a voice and can accelerate your career. We value unique thoughts and celebrate individuality, and with ample opportunity to learn, develop yourself, and expand into different roles, joining Pure is an investment in your career journey.
Through our Pure Equality program, which supports a flourishing field of employee resource groups, we nourish the personal and professional lives of our team members. And our Pure Good Foundation gives back to local and global communities through volunteering and grants.
And because we understand the value of bringing your full and best self to work, we offer a variety of perks to manage a healthy balance, including flexible time off, wellness resources, and company-sponsored team events.
PURE IS COMMITTED TO EQUALITY.
Research shows that in order to apply for a job, women feel they need to meet 100% of the criteria while men usually apply after meeting about 60%. Regardless of how you identify, if you believe you can do the job and are a good match, we encourage you to apply.
Pure is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other characteristic legally protected by the laws of the jurisdiction in which you are being considered for hire. 
If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at TA-Ops@purestorage.com.
